So what's the problem with this? If there are problems arising that PETA (whom I have little use for btw) takes offense to can they stop the problems sooner? Can they save their own asses without it being criminalized? Btw, who had more arrests & problems with the law? Who's tried to change their operations to better treat the animals? If you don't like them don't go, if you like meat eat it. But I really don't see a problem with them sitting in on the meetings.
I think it is. I met entirely too many kids who openly admitted they just wanted to be able to legally kill people.....

I just watched this interview in full. I dont know what i would do if my child was a victim. However i hope that i would not blame this mom after all the time that has past. She is living a life of personal hell and torment. It makes me think of the Amish and how they reached out to the shooters wife in their time of tragedy. It amazes me how different cultures handle horrible situations. It also makes me furious! Mental health issues are real, they are hurting more people than we want to admit. Yet we ignore that and focus so strongly on gun control. Yes gun control is an issue to address, but if we don't address mental health especially among our children, this will never stop. Let us remember Where there is a will there is a way. These kids that need help will find just that.
